avalancheActivity.comment: A small slab was reported in Bláfjöll on February 22nd along with small sloughs and cornice fall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Thawing has affected the snowpack up to the mountain tops, and a significant amount of snow has melted. The snowpack is now uniform and has strengthened in colder weather. Small wind slabs could form in W-directions and deposit snow in depressions and gullies.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted, compacting into a crust on Sunday and Monday. When freezing occurred on Tuesday, the snowpack strengthened again. Since then, there has been light snowfall in the area, and small wind slabs could form in east-facing gullies and valleys.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in south-facing slopes in the Tuesday snowfall in North and East parts. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during thaw throughout the country on Monday. Wind slabs could have formed on southerly aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snýst í norðaustan 3-8 mánudagskvöld, léttir til og frystir. Austan og norðaustan 3-8 og skýjað á þriðjudag, en stöku él sunnantil eftir hádegi. Frost 0 til 4 stig.

avalancheActivity.comment: A wet avalanche occurred during the thaw on Monday. A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snowfall on Tuesday during NE-winds could have caused windslabs on SW-aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The thaw on Monday reached to high elevations. Snowfall on Tuesday during strong NE-winds might have formed windslabs on SW-aspects. The underlying snowpack is most likely becoming rather stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in south-facing slopes in the Tuesday snowfall in North and East parts. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during thaw throughout the country on Monday. Wind slabs could have formed on southerly aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur hægur vindur og úrkomulítið á miðvikudag en aftur NA-átt á fimmtudag og líkur á snjókomu. Útlit fyrir svipað veður á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Two size 2 avalanches were reported in Illviðrishnjúkur after snowfall on Tuesday. A size 2.5 avalanche was reported in Klaufabrekkuskarð. Several wet and dry slab avalanches occurred in Ólafsfjörður and along the Ólafsfjarðarvegur road at the end of last week when heavy snowfall and strong northerly winds occurred. Additionally, an avalanche occurred at the same time in Mjóageiri near Dalvík.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Updated 28.02.2024: New snow is in the area after Tuesday and may have formed unstable slabs. Avalanches may release with sun effect today. The thaw on Monday affected the snowpack up to the mountaintops, but it"s likely that it has stiffened and strengthened as it refroze on Tuesday. Wind slab formation could be present on the south- and east-facing slopes following northwesterly snow showers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable wind slabs may be present in S- and E- aspects after snowfall on Tuesday. The thaw on Monday has affected the snowpack up to the mountaintops, and after refreezing it has stiffened and strengthened. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely strengthened during the warm spells, but a deeper weakness near the older firn is likely still present, as stability tests over the weekend showed fractures under moderate to heavy loads. Propagation saw test indicated that the layer breaks easily, and faceted crystals are still present. However, significant stress or warming is likely required for avalanches to release on this layer, as the upper layers have stiffened and bridged the lower layers in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in south-facing slopes in the Tuesday snowfall in North and East parts. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during thaw throughout the country on Monday. Wind slabs could have formed on southerly aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt miðvikudags lægir og styttir upp, suðlæg átt 3-8 og bjart með köflum á miðvikudag. Frost 2 til 12 stig. Hæg, breytileg átt og él á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a slab avalanche of size 2 in Stafdalur on Feb 25th. Older avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður and Fagridalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are present. It snowed on Tuesday during strong W/NW gale with further windslab formation, especially on S-E aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered windslabs are present on most aspects after variable winds. The bond between layers in the windslabs could be unstable. It snowed on Tuesday during W/NW winds which will most likely formed windslabs on S-E aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in south-facing slopes in the Tuesday snowfall in North and East parts. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during thaw throughout the country on Monday. Wind slabs could have formed on southerly aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma um tíma í hægum austlægum áttum síðdegis á miðvikudag og snýst í NA-læga átt á fimmtudag. Á föstudag er útlit fyrir norðlæga átt með snjókomu. Áfram kalt í veðri.
